content: make a string of realistically proportioned c9-size big outdoor holiday lights out of leftover yarn using just a few simple stitches these cheerful decorations will not only never burn out but will help to use up odds and ends of yarn from your scrap bin **1 bulb** = 6 yards **1 socket** = 2 yards **cord** = approx 50 yards the length of the garland is entirely up to you and however many bits and bobs of yarn leftovers you may have lying around length estimated is for a 10 garland for fun variations try making bulbs with variegated yarn too the pattern can also size up or down with different yarn weights and hook sizes **techniques / abbreviations used us terms ** * crochet in the round round * magic_ring * stitch / stitches st / sts * slip_stitch slip_stitch * chain chain * single_crochet single_crochet * back loop only blo * front loop only flo * invisible decrease * fasten_off fo this pattern is free to use a holiday gift from me to you please do not distribute it as your own work if you use this pattern please give credit thank you ❤️
